content: Universal Studios theme park in Singapore[Resorts World Sentosa](/wiki/Resorts_World_Sentosa)Attractions - Universal Studios Singapore - [Adventure Cove Waterpark](/wiki/Adventure_Cove_Waterpark) - [Singapore Oceanarium](/wiki/Singapore_Oceanarium) - [The Maritime Experiential Museum](/wiki/The_Maritime_Experiential_Museum) - Dolphin Island - Festive Walk Hotels - Crockfords Tower - Equarius Hotel - Festive Hotel - Hard Rock Hotel - Hotel Michael - Beach Villas - Genting Hotel Jurong - v - t - e **Universal Studios Singapore**[a] ([abbreviation](/wiki/Abbreviation): **USS**) is a [theme park](/wiki/Theme_park) located within the [Resorts World Sentosa](/wiki/Resorts_World_Sentosa) integrated resort at [Sentosa](/wiki/Sentosa) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It features 24 [rides](/wiki/Theme_park#Rides_and_attractions), shows, and [attractions](/wiki/Theme_park#Rides_and_attractions) in seven themed zones. It is one of the five [Universal Studios theme parks](/wiki/Universal_Destinations_%26_Experiences) around the world. It was a key component of [Genting Singapore](/wiki/Genting_Singapore)'s bid for the right to build Singapore's second integrated resort (IR). On 8 December 2006, the Singapore government announced that the consortium had won the bid. Construction of the theme park and the rest of the resort started on 19 April 2007. It is the second [Universal Studios theme park](/wiki/Universal_Destinations_%26_Experiences) in Asia, the first being [Universal Studios Japan](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Japan) in Osaka, and the only one in [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia). Official plans for the park were first unveiled to the public when Universal Studios Singapore released a map of the entire park on 20 October 2009. Universal Studios Singapore attracted more than 2 million visitors in the 9 months from its opening. The park officially began operations on 28 May 2011. Over 3 million guests visited the park in its opening year. Since then, Universal Studios Singapore has had approximately 4 million visitors every year. Visitors are made up of local Singaporeans and international tourists. It has been marketed by [Universal Destinations & Experiences](/wiki/Universal_Destinations_%26_Experiences) as a "one-of-its-kind theme park in Asia" and that the park was the only one of its kind in Southeast Asia for the foreseeable future. According to the AECOM Theme Index Global Attraction Attendance Report, Universal Studios Singapore is one of the top visited amusement/theme parks worldwide. ## History ### Park history The construction of Resorts World Sentosa and Universal Studios Singapore began on 19 April 2008. After almost two years of construction, the park opened on 18 March 2010. Universal Studios Singapore was opened for "sneak peek week" in view of the [Chinese New Year](/wiki/Chinese_New_Year) Celebrations, from 5 pm to 9 pm every night between 14 and 21 February 2010. Though visitors had to pay SGD$10 to enter the park even though rides were not operating, tickets for the week were sold out in 2 days. On 5 March 2010, it was announced that the park will open its doors at 8:28 am ([UTC+8](/wiki/UTC%2B8)) on 18 March 2010, for a soft-opening phase. From 13 March 2010, the team members of Resorts World Sentosa and their families had a chance to visit the park before it opened to the public. The park had its soft opening period from 18 March 2010 to 26 October 2010. The official grand opening of the park was held on 28 May 2011, along with the "grand opening gala" held on 27 May 2011 evening. It had Asian personalities [Jet Li](/wiki/Jet_Li), [Maggie Cheung](/wiki/Maggie_Cheung), [Zhao Wei](/wiki/Zhao_Wei), and former *[American Idol](/wiki/American_Idol)* judge [Paula Abdul](/wiki/Paula_Abdul) making an appearance at the gala event, along with some 1,600 guests. On 21 October 2011, Universal Studios Singapore began their [Halloween Horror Nights](/wiki/Halloween_Horror_Nights) events. On 3 April 2019, Genting Group announced the expansion of Universal Studios Singapore with two new themed areas, Minion Land and [Super Nintendo World](/wiki/Super_Nintendo_World). ### Timeline DateEvent19 Apr 2008Universal Studios Singapore begins its construction.21 Oct 2008Transformers: The Ride – 3D is announced to be a part of the lineup of attractions at Universal Studios Singapore.24 Sep 2009Plans are revealed for Shrek's Far Far Away and Madagascar-themed zones.20 Oct 2009[Resorts World Sentosa](/wiki/Resorts_World_Sentosa) unveils the attractions, dining options and merchandise outlets at Universal Studios Singapore.14 Feb 2010Beginning of the eight-day sneak-peek period of Universal Studios Singapore.18 Mar 2010Universal Studios Singapore soft-opens, with 16 of its 24 attractions opened and fully functioning.25 Mar 2010Battlestar Galactica dueling coasters is closed due to a technical glitch in the ride. Both rides would remain closed for many weeks thereafter.2 Jul 2010Premiere of the Lake Hollywood Spectacular show, which would be presented to park visitors every Friday and Saturday nights.20 Aug 2010X-ray findings reveal cracks in the welded joint of the seat-post supports within the Human roller coaster car of Battlestar Galactica, which caused the grounding of both roller coaster rides.21 Dec 2010Battlestar Galactica enters its final testing stage with newly reinforced coaster cars for both the Human and Cylon coasters. Both rides are slated to re-open in the first half of 2011.21 Feb 2011Official re-opening of the Battlestar Galactica dueling coasters.16 May 2011Scheduled opening of Madagascar: A Crate Adventure.28 May 2011Grand opening of Universal Studios Singapore.21 Oct 2011[Universal's Halloween Horror Nights](/wiki/Universal%27s_Halloween_Horror_Nights) makes its debut at Universal Studios Singapore.3 Dec 2011Scheduled opening of Transformers: The Ride – 3D at Universal Studios Singapore. The ride would have its world premiere at an exclusive evening event on 2 December 2011 with film director [Michael Bay](/wiki/Michael_Bay) present at the event.31 Dec 2011Launch of the park's first parade, Hollywood Dreams.29 May 2012[Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase](/wiki/Sesame_Street_Spaghetti_Space_Chase) is announced to be the newest addition to the park, scheduled to be open by the end of the year. The ride would replace the Stage 28 attraction, which had been cancelled and would be housed within its premise. The park would go on to introduce one stage show, two street shows, as well as meet-and-greets sessions featuring the [characters](/wiki/Character_(arts)) from *[Sesame Street](/wiki/Sesame_Street)*.1 Mar 2013Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase officially opens to the public.18 Apr 2013Universal Studios Singapore celebrates its tenth million visitor.21 Jul 2013Battlestar Galactica is closed again.29 Jul 2014[Puss in Boots' Giant Journey](/wiki/Puss_in_Boots%27_Giant_Journey) is announced to be the newest addition to the park. The park would also introduce a new stage show at Far Far Away, with The Dance For The Magic Beans featuring [Puss in Boots](/wiki/Puss_in_Boots_(Shrek)) and [Kitty Softpaws](/wiki/Kitty_Softpaws), as well as a meet-and-greet right after the show. The new ride would be scheduled to open by first quarter of 2015.19 Feb 2015Debut of the Universal Party Parade, which is a refreshment of the park's 2011 Hollywood Dreams parade, as part of the park's fifth anniversary celebrations.8 Apr 2015[Puss in Boots' Giant Journey](/wiki/Puss_in_Boots%27_Giant_Journey) officially opens to the public.27 May 2015Reopening of Battlestar Galactica again, after another two years of inactivity.24 Jan 2017Universal Studios Singapore celebrates its 25th million visitor.18 Jan 2019Launch of Universal After Hours, which includes nighttime exclusive programmes. Included is the debut of the Hollywood Dreams Light-Up Parade, which is a nighttime version of the park's 2015 Universal Party Parade.3 Apr 2019Announcement of a future park expansion with two new themed zones planned; Minion Land and [Super Nintendo World](/wiki/Super_Nintendo_World).6 Apr 2020Universal Studios Singapore closes temporarily due to the [COVID-19 pandemic](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic).1 Jul 2020Park reopens with limited capacity and operating hours.[b]27 Mar 2022Closure of Madagascar area.26 May 2022Construction works begin for Minion Land and Super Nintendo World.14 Feb 2025Minion Land officially opens to the public. ### Attendance YearAttendanceRef.20102,000,00020113,411,00020123,480,00020133,650,00020143,840,00020154,200,00020164,100,00020174,220,00020184,400,00020194,500,00020201,098,00020211,200,00020222,100,0002023—N/a ## Park layout Universal Studios Singapore is 25 hectares (62 acres) in size, making it the smallest of Universal's parks, and occupies the easternmost part of the 49-hectare (120-acre) Resorts World Sentosa. There are a total of 17 attractions, of which 10 are original or specially adapted for the park. The park consists of seven themed zones surrounding a [lagoon](/wiki/Lagoon). Each zone is mostly based on movies and/or television, featuring their own attractions, meet and greet locations, over 30 restaurants and food carts, and 20 retail stores and carts located around the park. Themed ZoneNotesHollywoodThemed after the real Hollywood Boulevard of the 1970s. Framed by "dynamic" architecture, palm trees and a replica of the [Hollywood 'Walk of Fame'](/wiki/Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame).New YorkThemed after post-modern New York City. Features replicas of New York landmarks. The area is enhanced by neon lights and flanked by street façades.Sci-Fi CityThemed after what cities and metropolis "may look like in the future", according to popular science fiction franchises.Ancient EgyptThemed after the Egyptian architecture and artifacts found during the "Golden Age of Egyptian Exploration in the 1930s".The Lost WorldThemed after two franchises, *[Jurassic Park](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(franchise))* and *[Waterworld](/wiki/Waterworld)*, which each have separate areas within the zone.Far Far AwayThemed after The Kingdom of Far Far Away featured in [DreamWorks Animation](/wiki/DreamWorks_Animation)'s *[Shrek](/wiki/Shrek_(franchise))*.Minion LandThemed after [Illumination](/wiki/Illumination_(company))'s *[Despicable Me](/wiki/Despicable_Me)* franchise. ### Hollywood *Hollywood* is the main entrance area of the park. Its only attraction, a broadway-style theatre, is accompanied by several restaurants and a variety of shopping locations. The zone is filled with Hollywood-inspired architecture and palm trees, including a replica of the [Hollywood Walk of Fame](/wiki/Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame). *[LazyTown](/wiki/LazyTown)*) ### New York City *New York City* is based on the original [New York City](/wiki/New_York_City), during the era of post-modernisation. The zone features various landmarks commonly portrayed in movies including the city skyline, neon lights, façades, and sidewalks. This zone also has a replica of the [New York Public Library](/wiki/New_York_Public_Library_Main_Branch). Special [DC Comics](/wiki/DC_Comics) character appearances include [Superman](/wiki/Superman), [Batman](/wiki/Batman), [Wonder Woman](/wiki/Wonder_Woman), [The Flash](/wiki/The_Flash), [Green Lantern](/wiki/Green_Lantern), [Supergirl](/wiki/Supergirl), [Robin](/wiki/Robin_(character)), [Batgirl](/wiki/Batgirl), [Aquaman](/wiki/Aquaman), [Mera](/wiki/Mera_(character)), [Cyborg](/wiki/Cyborg_(DC_Comics)), [Jor-El](/wiki/Jor-El), [Martian Manhunter](/wiki/Martian_Manhunter), [Green Arrow](/wiki/Green_Arrow), [Plastic Man](/wiki/Plastic_Man), [Shazam](/wiki/Shazam_(DC_Comics)), [Black Adam](/wiki/Black_Adam), [Blue Beetle](/wiki/Blue_Beetle_(Jaime_Reyes)), [Lex Luthor](/wiki/Lex_Luthor), [General Zod](/wiki/General_Zod), [Bizarro](/wiki/Bizarro), [Brainiac](/wiki/Brainiac_(character)), [Darkseid](/wiki/Darkseid), [Hank Henshaw](/wiki/Hank_Henshaw), [Doomsday](/wiki/Doomsday_(DC_Comics)), [Parasite](/wiki/Parasite_(comics)), [The Joker](/wiki/Joker_(character)), [Harley Quinn](/wiki/Harley_Quinn), [Catwoman](/wiki/Catwoman), [The Penguin](/wiki/Penguin_(character)), [The Riddler](/wiki/Riddler), [Poison Ivy](/wiki/Poison_Ivy_(character)), [Mr. Freeze](/wiki/Mr._Freeze), [Scarecrow](/wiki/Scarecrow_(DC_Comics)), [Two-Face](/wiki/Two-Face), [Bane](/wiki/Bane_(DC_Comics)), [Hugo Strange](/wiki/Hugo_Strange), [Killer Croc](/wiki/Killer_Croc), [Clayface](/wiki/Clayface), [Black Mask](/wiki/Black_Mask_(character)), [Cheetah](/wiki/Cheetah_(character)), [Giganta](/wiki/Giganta), [Doctor Poison](/wiki/Doctor_Poison), [Reverse-Flash](/wiki/Reverse-Flash), [Mirror Master](/wiki/Mirror_Master), [Black Flash](/wiki/Black_Flash), [Sinestro](/wiki/Sinestro), [Atrocitus](/wiki/Atrocitus), [Star Sapphire](/wiki/Carol_Ferris), [Black Manta](/wiki/Black_Manta), [Ocean Master](/wiki/Ocean_Master), [Deathstroke](/wiki/Deathstroke), [Gizmo](/wiki/Gizmo_(DC_Comics)) and [Silver Banshee](/wiki/Silver_Banshee). Special *[Sesame Street](/wiki/Sesame_Street)* character appearances include [Elmo](/wiki/Elmo), [Big Bird](/wiki/Big_Bird), [Count von Count](/wiki/Count_von_Count), [Abby Cadabby](/wiki/Abby_Cadabby), [Bert](/wiki/Bert_and_Ernie#Bert), [Ernie](/wiki/Bert_and_Ernie#Ernie), [Grover](/wiki/Grover), [Cookie Monster](/wiki/Cookie_Monster) and [Oscar the Grouch](/wiki/Oscar_the_Grouch). Special *[Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles](/wiki/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_(2012_TV_series))* character appearances include [Leonardo](/wiki/Leonardo_(Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles)), [Donatello](/wiki/Donatello_(Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles)), [Raphael](/wiki/Raphael_(Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles)), [Michelangelo](/wiki/Michelangelo_(Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles)), [Splinter](/wiki/Splinter_(Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles)), [April O'Neil](/wiki/April_O%27Neil), [Bebop](/wiki/Bebop_and_Rocksteady), [Rocksteady](/wiki/Bebop_and_Rocksteady) and [Foot Soldiers](/wiki/Foot_Clan). Special *[Madagascar](/wiki/Madagascar_(franchise))* character appearances include [Alex](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Alex), [Gloria](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Gloria) and [King Julien](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#King_Julien_XIII). Hosted by Steven Spielberg](/wiki/Lights!_Camera!_Action!_Hosted_by_Steven_Spielberg)ShowA show that features special effects that mimic a major hurricane.**Operating on Certain Days**[Sesame Street Spaghetti Space Chase](/wiki/Sesame_Street_Spaghetti_Space_Chase)[Steel](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster) [Suspended](/wiki/Suspended_roller_coaster) [Dark Ride](/wiki/Dark_ride)A suspended dark ride themed to the *[Sesame Street](/wiki/Sesame_Street)* franchise.**Operating**Loui's NY Pizza ParlorF&B OutletA pizza parlor that sells modern and traditional Italian pizzas as well as other local dishes. [Halal](/wiki/Halal)-certified.**Open**KT's GrillF&B OutletA full-service restaurant that specializes in New York grill cuisine and self-proclaimed "East meets West" dishes.**Temporarily Closed**Big Bird's EmporiumRetail OutletA retail store selling *[Sesame Street](/wiki/Sesame_Street)*-themed merchandise.**Open** **Entertainment** - **Rhythm Truck** ### Sci-Fi City *Sci-Fi City* is themed to a supposed [metropolis](/wiki/Metropolis) of the future. It is the home of a pair of [Vekoma](/wiki/Vekoma) [dueling roller coasters](/wiki/Dueling_roller_coaster). *[Henry Danger](/wiki/Henry_Danger)* character appearances include Kid Danger and Captain Man. *[Transformers](/wiki/Transformers)* character appearances include [Optimus Prime](/wiki/Optimus_Prime), [Bumblebee](/wiki/Bumblebee_(Transformers)) and [Megatron](/wiki/Megatron). *[Power Rangers](/wiki/Power_Rangers)* character appearances include [Red Ranger](/wiki/Jason_Lee_Scott), [Pink Ranger](/wiki/Kimberly_Hart), [Yellow Ranger](/wiki/Trini_Kwan), [Blue Ranger](/wiki/Billy_Cranston), [Green Ranger](/wiki/Tommy_Oliver) and [Black Ranger](/wiki/Zack_Taylor). NameTypeNotesStatus (June 2022)Battlestar Galactica: HUMAN[Steel](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster) [Dueling](/wiki/Dueling_roller_coaster) [Seated Roller Coaster](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster)A sit-down roller coaster that was designed for a tamer experience than its counterpart, with no inversions. Made by [Vekoma](/wiki/Vekoma), the trains are modeled after the Colonial Mark II Viper used by the Human faction as seen in the [*Battlestar Galactica* series](/wiki/Battlestar_Galactica_(2004_TV_series)).**Operating**Battlestar Galactica: CYLON[Steel](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster) [Dueling](/wiki/Dueling_roller_coaster) [Inverted](/wiki/Inverted_roller_coaster) [Roller Coaster](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster)An inverted roller coaster that was designed for a more thrilling experience than its counterpart, with inversions. It is also from [Vekoma](/wiki/Vekoma), just like the more mild **Human** side. The trains are modeled after the Cylon Heavy Raider used by the Cylon faction as seen in the [*Battlestar Galactica* series](/wiki/Battlestar_Galactica_(2004_TV_series)).**Operating**Transformers: The Ride – 3D[4-D](/wiki/4-D_film) [Dark Ride](/wiki/Dark_ride) [Motion Simulator](/wiki/Motion_simulator)A dark ride that uses the same ride-vehicle technology as [The Amazing Adventures of Spider-Man](/wiki/The_Amazing_Adventures_of_Spider-Man). It has giant wrap-around screens that sport photo-realistic 3D-HD video imagery, along with additional [4-D](/wiki/4D_film) effects that further enhances the ride experience. This attraction first premiered in Singapore in December 2011, and later at [Universal Studios Hollywood](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Hollywood) and [Orlando](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Florida).**Operating**Accelerator[Teacups](/wiki/Teacups)A whirling twirling ride that spins guests around. A similar ride, [Storm Force Accelatron](/wiki/Storm_Force_Accelatron), is found in [Universal Islands of Adventure](/wiki/Universal_Islands_of_Adventure) at [Universal Orlando Resort](/wiki/Universal_Orlando).**Operating**Galactica PXRetail OutletA retail store selling photos of the [Battlestar Galactica ride](/wiki/Battlestar_Galactica_(roller_coaster)). It formerly sold other sci-fi merchandise.**Temporarily Closed**Transformers Supply VaultRetail OutletA retail outlet selling a variety of *[Transformers](/wiki/Transformers)* and Transformers: The Ride – 3D merchandise.**Open**StarBot CaféF&B OutletA food and beverage outlet selling a variety of items, including ice cream.**Open** ### Ancient Egypt *Ancient Egypt* is based on the historical adaptation of [Ancient Egypt](/wiki/Ancient_Egypt) during the 1930s [Golden Age](/wiki/Golden_Age) of Egyptian Exploration. It features obelisks and pyramids which are typical of Ancient Egypt. Also featured are [Pharaohs'](/wiki/Pharaoh) [tombs](/wiki/Tomb) which were supposedly commonly discovered during that era. This zone relies on the depictions made in the popular film franchise, *[The Mummy](/wiki/The_Mummy_(franchise)#Stephen_Sommers_series_(1999–2008))*, starring [Brendan Fraser](/wiki/Brendan_Fraser). NameTypeNotesStatus (November 2022)[Revenge of the Mummy: The Ride](/wiki/Revenge_of_the_Mummy)[Enclosed](/wiki/Enclosed_roller_coaster) [Steel Roller Coaster](/wiki/Steel_roller_coaster) [Dark Ride](/wiki/Dark_ride)A combination dark ride and roller coaster that is built within an indoor space. Made by [Premier Rides](/wiki/Premier_Rides), this ride was inspired and developed from *[The Mummy](/wiki/The_Mummy_(1999_film))* film from 1999.**Operating**[Treasure Hunters](/wiki/Treasure_Hunters_(Universal_Studios_Singapore))Mini-Car RideA leisure car ride that drives around an abandoned Egyptian excavation site. The ride vehicles are modeled after the look of vintage jeeps. Animatronic animals within the attraction include hippos, some vultures, many cobras, a cheetah, and Nile crocodiles.**Operating**Carter's CuriositiesRetail OutletA retail outlet selling souvenirs and replicas of Egyptian treasures.**Open**Oasis Spice CaféF&B OutletAn Egyptian-themed cafeteria serving specialties from various north African and Middle-Eastern cultures.**Open** ### The Lost World *The Lost World* contains many traditional attractions present in most Universal Studios parks around the world. The zone is divided into two areas: *Jurassic Park* and *Waterworld*. Jurassic Park, based on the [popular film franchise](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(franchise)) by [Steven Spielberg](/wiki/Steven_Spielberg) and novels by [Michael Crichton](/wiki/Michael_Crichton), features the newly redesigned Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure which is based on the [water rides](/wiki/List_of_Jurassic_Park_water_rides) in other Universal Studios parks. Waterworld, based on the film *[Waterworld](/wiki/Waterworld)* starring [Kevin Costner](/wiki/Kevin_Costner), features a live show performance at an amphitheater. NameTypeNotesStatus (March 2023)[Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_Rapids_Adventure)[River Rapids Raft System](/wiki/River_rapids_ride)A river rapids ride that features a white water raft system where riders on circular rafts are sent down a rapid with [animatronic](/wiki/Animatronic) dinosaurs.**Operating**[WaterWorld](/wiki/WaterWorld)Live Show/PerformanceA live-action performance that involves stunts and pyrotechnics, surrounding by and using a large pool of water.**Temporarily Closed**Canopy FlyerSetpoint Swing ThingRiders board the roller coaster suspended on a track, which holds two guests front-facing, and two back-facing. As the car moves up the lift hill, the theme music from Jurassic Park plays via nearby speakers. The cars go up a high distance in the air and travel around the Jurassic Park-area, including a 360-degree turn over [Jurassic Park Rapids Adventure](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_Rapids_Adventure), before returning to the station.**Operating**Dino-Soarin'[Fly Around Ride](/wiki/Aerial_carousel)An [aerial carousel](/wiki/Aerial_carousel)-styled children's ride that spins around, with riders being able to control the vertical height of their [pteranodon](/wiki/Pteranodon)-styled ride vehicle.**Operating**Amber Rock Climb[Rock Climb](/wiki/Rock_climbing)/Skill ChallengeA rock-climbing attraction that is themed after a dinosaur dig site. The attraction can only accommodate guests between 34 kg (75 lb) and 310 kg (680 lb).**Temporarily Closed**Jurassic OutfittersRetail OutletA retail store that sells official *[Jurassic Park](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(franchise))* merchandise.**Temporarily Closed**The Dino-StoreRetail OutletA retail store that sells *[Jurassic Park](/wiki/Jurassic_Park_(franchise))* and other dinosaur-related merchandise.**Open**Fossil FuelsF&B OutletA food stand that sells light snacks and frozen beverages.**Open**Discovery Food CourtF&B OutletA food court that is themed after the Discovery Centre building featured in the [original *Jurassic Park* movie](/wiki/Jurassic_Park).**Open** ### Far Far Away *Far Far Away* is inspired by [DreamWorks Animation](/wiki/DreamWorks_Animation)'s *[Shrek](/wiki/Shrek_(franchise))* franchise. The zone consists of many locations from the film series, with a landmark in the form of "*Far Far Away Castle*". Character appearances include [Shrek](/wiki/Shrek_(character)), [Donkey](/wiki/Donkey_(Shrek)), [Puss in Boots](/wiki/Puss_in_Boots_(Shrek)), [Princess Fiona](/wiki/Princess_Fiona), Kitty Softpaws, [Gingy](/wiki/The_Gingerbread_Man), [Pinocchio](/wiki/Pinocchio), [Prince Charming](/wiki/Prince_Charming), [Fairy Godmother](/wiki/Fairy_Godmother_(Shrek)) and [Humpty Dumpty](/wiki/Humpty_Dumpty). NameNotesStatus (June 2022)[Shrek 4-D Adventure](/wiki/Shrek_4-D)A [3-D stereoscopic](/wiki/3D_film) show with physical effects.**Showing**Puss in Boots' Giant JourneyA one of a kind [Zamperla](/wiki/Zamperla) "Nineinverted coaster" based on the [Puss in Boots](/wiki/Puss_in_Boots_(Shrek)) spin-off franchise. The exterior entrance is themed to the ruins of a large castle, overgrown in ivy. In the queue, Puss and [Kitty Softpaws](/wiki/Kitty_Softpaws) introduce riders to the attraction's story, which involves them stealing eggs from a giant goose to save an orphanage. The nine guests per ride-vehicle experience the story throughout the rollercoaster via the vehicle's speaker system, and by passing several lifesize statues of Puss, Kitty, a giant goose, and its children.**Operating**Enchanted AirwaysA junior roller coaster that passes through the area, with trains modeled after [Dragon](/wiki/Dragon_(Shrek)) from *[Shrek](/wiki/Shrek_(franchise))*. Throughout the ride, guests encounter statues of fairy tale characters and environments from the *Shrek* franchise as well. The queue is located within a medieval-style tent.**Operating**Donkey LiveAn interactive live show using [digital puppetry](/wiki/Digital_puppetry) technology, which features [Donkey](/wiki/Donkey_(Shrek)) entertaining and engaging guests.**Showing**Magic Potion SpinA miniature [Ferris wheel](/wiki/Ferris_wheel) for children themed to a part of a potion assembly line. The ride is located within the Fairy Godmother's Potion Shop.**Operating**Fairy Godmother's Potion ShopA retail outlet with memorabilia, drinks and gifts from the *[Shrek](/wiki/Shrek_(franchise))* franchise.**Open**Fairy Godmother's Juice BarA drink store that sells juices themed to look like magical concoctions.**Temporarily Closed**GoldilocksA food outlet that sells fried chicken, fish and chips, chicken sandwiches, mashed potatoes with gravy, coleslaw, and French fries. [Halal](/wiki/Halal)-certified.**Open**Friar'sA food stand that sells hot and cold sandwich wraps with potato chips.**Temporarily Closed** ### Minion Land *Minion Land* is inspired by [Illumination](/wiki/Illumination_(company))'s *[Despicable Me](/wiki/Despicable_Me)* franchise. The zone is divided into three areas: *Minion Marketplace*, *Gru's Neighborhood*, and *Super Silly Fun Land*. Character appearances include [Gru](/wiki/Gru), Lucy, Margo, Edith, Agnes and the [Minions](/wiki/Minions_(Despicable_Me)). NameTypeNotesStatus (February 2025)[Despicable Me Minion Mayhem](/wiki/Despicable_Me_Minion_Mayhem)[Motion Simulator](/wiki/Motion_simulator)A 3D motion simulator where guests are transformed into [Minions](/wiki/Minions_(Despicable_Me)) and undergo training. Meanwhile, [Gru](/wiki/Gru)'s daughters try to give Gru a present to commemorate the anniversary of their adoption.**Operating**Silly Swirly[Swing ride](/wiki/Swing_ride)A unique swing ride where guests spin and soar through the sky while catching views of Super Silly Fun Land and the lagoon.**Operating**Buggie Boogie[Carousel](/wiki/Carousel)The world's first Minions' dance party carousel with new music remixed by the Minions.**Operating**Minion MarketplaceRetail OutletA shopping zone that includes a candy store "Sweet Surender" and souvenir shops "Fun Store" and "Pop Store".**Operating**Super Hungry Food StandF&B OutletA carnival-themed restaurant serving foods themed to the Minions.**Operating** ## Upcoming attractions ### Super Nintendo World This section needs to be **updated**. The reason given is: There has not been any updates from the park on this zone after 2020. Please help update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information. *(August 2025)* *[Super Nintendo World](/wiki/Super_Nintendo_World)* is inspired by [Nintendo](/wiki/Nintendo) franchises such as *[Mario](/wiki/Mario_(franchise))*. Character appearances will include [Mario](/wiki/Mario), [Luigi](/wiki/Luigi_(character)) and [Princess Peach](/wiki/Princess_Peach). It is currently unknown if this iteration of Super Nintendo World will be similar to [Universal Studios Hollywood](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Hollywood)'s version, [Universal Studios Japan](/wiki/Universal_Studios_Japan)'s version, or [Universal Epic Universe](/wiki/Universal_Epic_Universe)'s version, or a completely new version altogether, as no attractions or "themed shops and restaurants" have been confirmed for the zone as of 2025. ## Former attractions ### Madagascar *Madagascar* was inspired by the [DreamWorks Animation](/wiki/DreamWorks_Animation) franchise [of the same name](/wiki/Madagascar_(franchise)). The zone featured a tropical [jungle](/wiki/Jungle) theming as well as two rides. The majority of this land closed on 27 March 2022, with the exception of the carousel King Julien's Beach Party-Go-Round, which closed later that year, and was re-themed and re-decorated with *Despicable Me* characters. The attraction reopened as Buggie Boogie in 2025. Character appearances included [Alex](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Alex), [Gloria](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Gloria), [King Julien](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#King_Julien_XIII), [Skipper](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Skipper), [Kowalski](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Kowalski), [Rico](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Rico) and [Private](/wiki/List_of_Madagascar_(franchise)_characters#Private). NameTypeNotesStatus (June 2022)Madagascar: A Crate Adventure[Water Boat Ride](/wiki/Water_ride)A river boat ride with animatronics, digital projection and surround sound, housed within the hull of a displaced cargo ship. This attraction features the voices of actors heard in the movies such as [Ben Stiller](/wiki/Ben_Stiller), [Chris Rock](/wiki/Chris_Rock), [David Schwimmer](/wiki/David_Schwimmer) and [Jada Pinkett Smith](/wiki/Jada_Pinkett_Smith) throughout the ride. Closed on 27 March 2022.**Permanently Closed**King Julien's Beach Party-Go-Round[Carousel](/wiki/Carousel)A [carousel](/wiki/Carousel) ride themed and decorated with all the characters of *[Madagascar](/wiki/Madagascar_(franchise))*. Closed for refurbishment in mid-2022.**Permanently Closed**Penguin MercantileRetail OutletA retail outlet located at the exit of 'Madagascar: A Crate Adventure' that sells plush hats, key fobs, T-shirts and other merchandise inspired by the *[Madagascar](/wiki/Madagascar_(franchise))* franchise, as well as on-ride photos for 'Madagascar: A Crate Adventure'. Closed on 27 March 2022.**Permanently Closed**Marty's Casa Del Wild Food CourtF&B OutletA café based on the first movie. The restaurant is hosted by [Marty](/wiki/Marty_(Madagascar)) the Zebra and serves a variety of South East Asian specialties such as Nasi Padang, Pad Thai, [Chicken Rice](/wiki/Hainanese_chicken_rice), Thai Green Chicken Curry, Tom Yum Soup and Asian Rotisserie Chicken. Closed on 27 March 2022.**Permanently Closed**Gloria's Snack ShackF&B OutletA food store hosted by [Gloria](/wiki/Gloria_(Madagascar)) the Hippo, which offers some Japanese-inspired quick bites such as [yakitori](/wiki/Yakitori), rice bowls and drinks. Closed on 27 March 2022.**Permanently Closed** ## Notes - Official website Portal: - Singapore
title: Universal Studios Singapore
